sentences.sContent: Over five million copies of the paper are printed every day.
sentences.sCn: 这份报纸每日印量超过五百万。

sentences.sContent: When the book was first written no publisher would print it.
sentences.sCn: 这本书刚写成时没有出版商愿意出版。

sentences.sContent: ...it will die off with the generation who read print newspapers...
...Inkling addresses several of the other shortcomings in traditional print as well...
...Here's how it works: When you purchase a used print book...
...What I mean by that is the current perspective of the digital textbook is it's an exact copy of the print book...
...But the worst part is that print versions of textbooks are constantly undergoing revisions...
...The shortcomings of traditional print edition textbooks are obvious: For starters they're heavy...
...billboard companies can print a billboard in 2 hours...
...Advertiser using the print media-magazines and newspapers-will need to adapt to two main changes...

synos.tran: [印刷]印刷业；印花布；印刷字体；印章；印记
[印刷]印刷；[计]打印；刊载；用印刷体写；在…印花样

phrases.pCn: （契约中）难懂的条文；极小的字体
（协议等上面用小号字体写成的）附属细则

words.tran: [计] 打印机；印刷工；印花工

trans.tranOther: to produce many printed copies of a book, newspaper etc
writing that has been printed, for example in books or newspapers
